text:
e="preserve">William Whitney Pursell (June 9, 1926 – September 3, 2020) was an American composer and onetime session pianist. He was best known for the top ten hit "Our Winter Love". He was born in Oakland, California.
His follow-up single "Loved" reached Billboard position 121. Pursell later recorded for Epic, Henry Stone's Alston, and Dot, but never hit the pop charts again.
He worked as a school teacher for Belmont University.
Pursell died of COVID-19 on September 3, 2020 in Nashville, Tennessee at the age of 94.
